titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Marion Belanger Photographs
titlestmt.author: by Matthew Daniel Mason

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 03:27

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Photographs created by Marion Belanger that document sites and activities in Hawaii, Utah, and Yellowstone National Park in Wyoming. Images captured 1998-2003, and printed 1998-2014. Photographs of Hawaii created in 1999 include sites on Hawaii Island and Maui, including Haleakala National Park and Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. Photographs of Utah created in 2003 include documentation of fowling for swan at the Bear River Migratory Bird Refuge as well as views of Great Salt Lake and of the Spiral Jetty , an earthwork sculpture built on the northeastern shore of the Great Salt Lake near Rozel Point in April 1970 by sculptor Robert Smithson. Photographs of sites in Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, created in 1998 include views of Mammoth Hot Springs and Old Faithful.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Marion Belanger on the Frederick W. and Carrie S. Beinecke Fund for Western Americana, 2014.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Hawaii, 1999-2014. II. Utah, 2003-2014. III. Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, 1998-2014.

bioghist.head: Marion Belanger (born 1957)
bioghist.p: Marion Belanger, Yale MFA 1990, is a photographer. Her work focuses on the cultural landscape, particularly where geology and the built environment intersect.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Marion Belanger Photographs. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards. For more information, please refer to the Beinecke Manuscript Unit Processing Manual.
Each folder in the collection contains a single photographic print or inkjet print.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs created by Marion Belanger that document sites and activities in Hawaii, Utah, and Yellowstone National Park in Wyoming. Images captured, 1998-2003, and printed 1998-2014. Photographs of Hawaii created in 1999 include sites on Hawaii Island and Maui, including Haleakala National Park and Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. Photographs of Utah created in 2003 include documentation of fowling for swan at the Bear River Migratory Bird Refuge as well as views of Great Salt Lake and of the Spiral Jetty , an earthwork sculpture built on the northeastern shore of the Great Salt Lake near Rozel Point in April 1970 by sculptor Robert Smithson. Photographs of sites in Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, created in 1998 include views of Mammoth Hot Springs and Old Faithful.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Marion Belanger Photographs are the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Views of sites in Hawaii created in 1999 and printed in 1999 and 2014 as selenium toned black-and-white gelatin silver prints, 16 x 20 inches (40.64 x 50.8 centimeters). This component includes sites on Hawaii Island and Maui, including Haleakala National Park and Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. The prints comprise an edition numbered one of fifteen except where an artist's proof is noted in this guide.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under two headings for Hawaii Island and Maui.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Site also known as Mahana Beach and Papakōlea Beach

unittitle.title: Lava Enveloped Road, Volcanoes National Park, Hawaii
Lava Over Road, Volcanoes National Park, Hawaii

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Utah made in 2003 of activities and sites at the Bear River Migratory Bird Refuge and of Great Salt Lake and its vicinity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Views that document fowling for swan at the Bear River Migratory Bird Refuge created in 2003 and printed in 2014 as color inkjet prints using pigmented ink on Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl Paper, 17 x 22 inches (43.18 x 55.88 centimeters). The prints comprise a library edition numbered one of four.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Views of Great Salt Lake, Utah, and of the Spiral Jetty , an earthwork sculpture built on the northeastern shore of the Great Salt Lake near Rozel Point in April 1970 by sculptor Robert Smithson (1938-1973), which is a 1,500-foot-long (460 meters), 15-foot-wide (4.6 meters) counterclockwise coil jutting into the water from the lakeshore. The images were created in 2003 and printed in 2014 that comprise selenium toned black-and-white gelatin silver prints, 16 x 20 inches (40.64 x 50.8 centimeters) and color inkjet prints using pigmented ink on Hahnemuhle Photo Rag Pearl Paper, 17 x 22 inches (43.18 x 55.88 centimeters). The black-and-white prints comprise an edition numbered one of fifteen. The color inkjet prints comprise a library edition numbered one of four.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized under two headings for Black-and-white Gelatin Silver Prints and Color Inkjet Prints

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Views of sites in Yellowstone National Park, Wyoming, including Mammoth Hot Springs and Old Faithful, were created in 1998 and printed in 1998 and 2014 as selenium toned black-and-white gelatin silver prints, 16 x 20 inches (40.64 x 50.8 centimeters). The prints comprise portions of editions numbered one and two of fifteen as well as artist's proofs and prints with no designated edition.
